perturbation.original_text: 2.5 "NET SALES" shall mean gross sales revenues and fees billed by Company from the sale of LICENSED PRODUCT(S) less trade discounts allowed, refunds, returns and recalls, and sales taxes. In the event that Company sells a LICENSED PRODUCT(S) in combination with other ingredients or substances or as part of a kit, the NET SALES for purposes of royalty payments shall be based on the sales revenues and fees received from the entire combination or kit.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.5 "NET SALES" shall mean gross sales revenues and fees billed by Company from the sale of LICENSED PRODUCT(S) less trade discounts allowed, refunds, returns and recalls, and sales taxes. In the event that Company sells a LICENSED PRODUCT(S) in combination with other ingredients or substances or as part of a kit, the NET SALES for purposes of royalty payments shall be based on the incremental cost of the LICENSED PRODUCT(S) versus the cost of the entire combination or kit.
perturbation.explanation: The original text bases royalties on the entire combination or kit's sales revenue. The modified text changes the basis to the incremental cost, potentially significantly reducing the royalty amount. This creates an internal contradiction on how NET SALES are calculated, impacting royalty payments.

perturbation.original_text: 4.2 Minimum Annual Royalties: Company shall pay to JHU minimum annual royalties as set forth in Exhibit A. These minimum annual royalties shall be due within thirty (30) days of each anniversary of the EFFECTIVE DATE beginning with the first anniversary. Running royalties accrued under Paragraph 4.3 and paid to JHU during the one year period preceding an anniversary of the EFFECTIVE DATE shall be credited against the minimum annual royalties due on that anniversary date.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.2 Minimum Annual Royalties: Company may pay to JHU minimum annual royalties as set forth in Exhibit A. These minimum annual royalties shall be due within sixty (60) days of each anniversary of the EFFECTIVE DATE beginning with the first anniversary. Running royalties accrued under Paragraph 4.3 and provided to JHU during the one year period preceding an anniversary of the EFFECTIVE DATE shall be credited against the minimum annual royalties due on that anniversary date.
perturbation.explanation: The original text enforces minimum annual royalties payments ('shall pay') whereas the modified text changes 'shall pay' to 'may pay'. This creates an optional clause. Additionally, the original text requires the due date to be within thirty (30) days and the modified text changes it to sixty (60) days.
